oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Public Sale of Mares, Cows, Hogs
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Poster advertising the sale of the property of the late Woodruff Parks, scheduled for August 13, 1870. Among the items sold were cows, hogs, sheep, wagons and farm implements and a mule. The administrator of the estate was Joel Parks.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; posters; Horses; Swine; Farmers; Cows; Mules; Estates
Broadsides; Livestock
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Woodruff Parks estate was located 5 miles east of Fayetteville on the Mulberry Turnpike.
